question: At 0700, Stratford Shoal Middle Ground Light bears 137°pgc.  From your radar, you get a bearing of 007°pgc to the south tip of Stratford Point with a range of 4.5 miles. What is your 0700 position?

At 0725, you are heading 054°T, and Stratford Point Light is abeam to port at 3.1 miles.  The current is 135°T at 1.8 knots.  If you make turns for an engine speed of 8 knots, which course must you steer to make good 048°T.

options: White octagonal house on a cylindrical pier
White conical tower with a brown band midway of height
Conical tower, upper half white, lower half brown
Black skeleton tower on a granite dwelling
question: Which structure should you look for while trying to locate Southwest Ledge Light?

At 0830, you obtained the following Loran-C readings:

 9960-X-26562.5
 9960-Y-44028.1

What is your vessel's position?

From your 0830 position, you wish to make good 097°T. There is no current, but a southerly wind is producing 3° leeway.  What course should you steer per standard magnetic compass in order to make good your true course?

At 0845, you are on a course of 097°T, and Townshend Ledge Buoy "10A" is close abeam to port.  With a westerly current of 1.2 knots, what speed will you have to turn for from your 0845 position in order to arrive abeam of Six Mile Reef Buoy "8C" at 1030?

At 0910, your DR position is LAT 41°11.9'N, LONG 72°47.8'W.  Your vessel is on course 097°T at 9.5 knots, and the weather is foggy.  At 0915, Branford Reef Light is sighted through a break in the fog bearing 318°T.  At 0945, Falkner Island Light is sighted bearing 042°T.  What is your 0945 running fix position?
What do the dotted lines around Goose Island and Kimberly Reef represent?

options: A bearing to Little Gull Island Light of not less than 090°
A Loran reading of more than 9960-Y-43985.0
Danger bearing to Black Point of not more than 064°T
A distance to Saybrook Breakwater Light of not less than 1.3 miles
question: At 1100, your position is LAT 41°11.3'N, LONG 72°28.0'W. You are steering a course of 069°T to leave Black Point one mile off your port beam.  It has been reported that the Long Sand Shoal Buoys and Hatchett Reef Buoys are off station.  Which of the following will serve as a line marking the hazards and keep your vessel in safe water?

options: lighted only during daytime when the sound signal is in operation
maintained only from May 1 to Oct 1
question: Little Gull Island Light is __________.
At 1210, you are in position LAT 41°14.3'N, LONG 72°16.5'W.  What is the depth of water below your keel?

From your 1210 position, you are making good a course of 083°T.  Your engines are turning RPMs for 10 knots.  The set and drift of the current are 310° at 1.7 knots.  At what time should you expect to enter the red sector of New London Harbor Light?
Your vessel is entering New London Harbor Channel.  If there is no current, what should you steer per gyro compass to stay on the range?
On chart 12354, the datum from which heights of objects are taken is __________.
The red sector of New London Harbor Light covers from __________.
What type of bottom is found at Long Sand Shoal?

options: the junction with the Connecticut River
question: You are southeast of Saybrook Breakwater Light passing Saybrook Bar Lighted Bell Buoy "8".  This buoy marks __________.

At 0005, on 26 January, your position is LAT 41°11.8'N, LONG 72°20.5'W.  From this position, you plot a course to steer to Mattituck Breakwater Light "MI" with an engine speed of 9.0 knots.  If there are no set and drift, what course should you steer?

At 0045, you obtain the following information:

 Radar range to Inlet Point is  1.4 miles;
 Radar range to Rocky Point is  2.8 miles.
 Radar range to Horton Point is 2.8 miles.

 What were the set and drift between 0005 and 0045?

options: The light is visible all the way to Mattituck Inlet
question: You alter course from your 0045 position to head for Mattituck Breakwater Light "MI".  If the visibility is 10 miles and you make good 9 knots, at what time will you lose sight of Saybrook Breakwater Light?

At 0100, you obtain the following radar ranges:

  Inlet Point  -    2.7 miles,
 Rocky Point  - 4.5 miles,
 Horton Point -  1.0 mile.

 What was the speed made good between 0045 and 0100?
According to the DR track line from your 0100 position, how far off Roanoke Point Shoal Buoy "5" should you be when the buoy is abeam?

From your 0130 position, you change course to adjust for set and drift, and you later obtain the following loran lines of position:

 9960-W-14975
 9960-X-26412
 9960-Y-43919

 What is the latitude and longitude of the loran fix?
At 0209, your position is LAT 41°01.8'N,  LONG 72°40.8'W.   What course should you steer per standard magnetic compass to make good 278° magnetic?  (assume no set and drift)

options: a high, flat plateau with sheer cliffs
low and marshy with isolated beaches
question: The south coast of Long Island Sound between Mattituck Inlet and Port Jefferson is __________.

At 0300, your position is LAT 41°01.7'N, LONG 72°55.1'W. From this position you steer a course of 289° per standard magnetic compass at an engine speed of 10.0 knots.  At what time can you first expect to see Stratford Shoal Middle Ground Light if the luminous range is 8.0 miles?
You must arrive at your final destination by 0800.  The distance from your 0300 position to the final destination is 40.5 miles.  What minimum speed must be made good to arrive on time?

You are northwest of Port Jefferson Harbor steering 242° per standard magnetic compass.  As you continue westward, you see that the Port Jefferson Range Front Light and Rear Light come into line.  If the deviation table is correct, the bearing of the range should be __________.
As you enter the New Haven Outer Channel, you sight the range markers in line directly over the stern.  Your heading at the time is 155.5° per gyrocompass.  What is the gyro error?
At 0720, you are in the outer channel between buoy "1" and buoy "2" and change course to pass Townshend Ledge Lighted Bell Buoy "10A" abeam to port at 200 yards.  What is your ETA off the buoy?

At 0740, you plot a loran fix from the following readings:

 9960-X-26542.0
 9960-Y-44023.0
 9960-W-15027.0

 What is your position?

From your 0740 position, you change course to pass 1.1 miles north of Falkner Island Light.  What loran reading will ensure that you will remain clear of the 18' shoal located 1 mile NW of Falkner Island Light?

options: You are making good your intended course and speed.
question: At 0802,  Branford Reef Light bears 348°T at 0.75 mile, and the north point of Falkner Island bears 088°T at 6.7 miles.  What were the set and drift since 0740?

options: The navigational regulations in Title 46, Code of Federal Regulations
question: What publication contains information on the navigational hazards in the vicinity of Falkner Island?
If there is no current, what is the course per standard magnetic compass from your 0802 fix to the position 1.1 miles north of Falkner Island Light?
At 0830, you wish to get the latest weather forecasts for the Falkner Island area.  On what frequency would you set your FM radio for this information?
At 0844, the range to the north end of Falkner Island is 2.0 miles and the left tangent bearing is 102°T.  What is the approximate charted depth of the water?

At 0925, you plot the following loran fix:

 9960-W-14931.5
 9960-X-26418.2
 9960-Y-44006.5

If you correct for a current setting 215°T at 0.5 knot, what course will you steer from the 0925 position to arrive at a position 0.5 mile south of Long Sand Shoal West End Horn Buoy "W"?
If you correct for the current in the previous question (215°T at 0.5 knot) and maintain an engine speed of 7.5 knots, what is your ETA 0.5 mile south of buoy "W"?
At what approximate distance would you expect Bartlett Reef Light to break the horizon, if the visibility is 27 nautical miles?

At 1038, you are 0.4 mile south of Long Sand Shoal Buoy "8A" on course 090°T when visibility is reduced to 1 mile in rain and haze.  You intend to stay on 090°T until your Loran shows a reading that you can safely follow to the approaches of New London.  Which of the following Loran readings will you look for?

At 1200, your position is 2.0 miles southwest of Bartlett Reef Light.  Your heading is 075°T.  Visibility is less than 0.2 mile in fog and rain.  Which of the following signals is most likely to be from another vessel?
What chart should you use after you enter New London Harbor?

You are on course 082°T, and the engines are turning for 8 knots.  At 0352, you take the following bearings:    
Stratford Point Light 016°pgc  Stratford Shoal (Middle Ground) Light 137°pgc  

What is your 0352 position?

options: You will not sight the light.
question: If the visibility is 11 miles, what is the earliest time you can expect to see New Haven Light?

options: deviation table is correct for that heading
deviation is 3.5°E for a bearing of 206° per standard magnetic compass
question: While on a heading of 082°T, you sight Middle Ground Light in line with Old Field Point Light bearing 206° per standard magnetic compass.  From this you can determine the __________.

The maximum ebb current at a location 4.3 miles south of Stratford Point will occur at 0413.  The predicted current will be 1.0 knot at 075°.  What will be your course made good if you steer 082°T at 8 knots?
The characteristic of Branford Reef Light is __________.

options: The current's drift is greater than predicted.
You are to the right of your intended track line.
The course made good since 0352 is 081°T.
question:
At 0415, you take the following bearings:

Stratford Point Light    329.5°pgc  
Middle Ground Light    223.5°pgc  
Old Field Point Light    199.5°pgc  

Which statement is TRUE?
If you change course at 0420, what is the course to make good to leave Twenty Eight Foot Shoal Lighted Buoy abeam to port at 1 mile?

At 0430, you take the following loran readings:

 9960-X-26605.5
 9960-Y-43985.0

What is your 0430 position?
From your 0430 position, what is the course per standard magnetic compass to a position where Twenty-eight foot Shoal lighted buoy "TE" is abeam to port at 1 mile?

By 0430, the wind has increased, and the visibility cleared due to passage of a front.  You estimate 3° leeway due to NW'ly winds.  What is the course per gyrocompass to pass 1.2 miles due south of Twenty-eight Foot Shoal Lighted Buoy "TE"?

At 0430, you change course and speed to make good 090°T at 10 knots. At 0433, you slow due to an engineering casualty and estimate you are making good 5.5 knots.  At what time will Branford Reef Light bear 000°T?
What is the approximate distance to New Bedford, MA, from your 0530 DR position, if your 0352 position was 7 miles from Bridgeport, CT?

options: Your course made good from 0630 to 0700 was 082°T.
The speed made good from 0630 to 0700 was 10.1 knots.
You are making good your intended speed.
The current from 0630 to 0700 was 279°T at 0.6 knot.
question: At 0550, engineering repairs are complete and speed is increased to 9.6 knots.  At 0630, Falkner Island Light bears 023°pgc and Horton Point Light bears 097°pgc.   From your 0630 fix you steer to make good a course of 086°T while turning for 9.6 knots.  At 0700, Falkner Island Light bears 336.0°pgc and Horton Point Light bears 105.5°pgc.  The radar range to the south tip of Falkner Island is 5.7 miles.  Which statement is TRUE?

options: marked by sandy beaches and wooded uplands
question: The south shore of Long Island Sound from Horton Point to Orient Point is __________.
Orient Point Light will break the horizon at a range of about __________.
At 0345, you set a course to depart New London Harbor. Assuming no set and drift, which standard magnetic compass course must you steer to stay in the middle of the channel?

options: The wreck presents a danger to all vessels with drafts in excess of 30 feet (9.1 meters).
The wreck is visible above the sounding datum between the months of March and June.
The wreck was cleared by wire drag in 1982 and will not appear on future charts.
The wreck is shown on the chart, but its actual existence is doubtful.
question: Which statement regarding the wreck 0.2 mile south of buoys "1" and "2" at the entrance to New London Harbor is TRUE?
At 0530, your position is LAT 41°12.6'N, LONG 72°08.5'W. What is the color of New London Harbor Light?
From your 0530 position, you set a course of 271°psc with an engine speed of 9 knots.  At 0645, Cornfield Safe-Water Buoy is abeam to starboard.  What speed have you averaged since 0530?

The broken magenta line which runs parallel to the shore between Roanoke Point and Mattituck Inlet marks a __________.
Assuming no current, at what time can you expect to be abeam of Townshend Ledge Lighted Buoy?
At 0730, visibility is 5.5 miles.  At what time will you lose sight of Horton Point Light?

At 0820, you take the following Loran-C readings:

 9960-W-14978.0
 9960-Y-43993.5
 9960-X-26464.1

What are the set and drift since 0730?

At 0820, you change course to 301°psc and reduce speed to 7.5 knots.  At 0900, you take the following visual bearings:

Branford Reef Light              023°psc  
New Haven Light                 293°psc  
Tweed Airport Aerobeacon  332°psc  

Your 0900 position is __________.

At 0900, the current is flooding in a direction of 350°T at 1.2 knots.  If your engines are turning RPMs for 9 knots, which course should you steer per standard magnetic compass to make good a course of 297° true?
Which chart would you use for more detailed information on New Haven Harbor?
What true course and speed did you make good between 0730 and 0900?
As you enter the New Haven Outer Channel, you sight the outer range markers in line directly ahead.  Your heading at this time is 347°psc.  What is your compass deviation by observation?
Which course should you change to per standard magnetic compass as you pass SW Ledge Light to remain in the channel?
Your position is LAT 40°59.0'N, LONG 73°06.2'W.  What is the course per standard magnetic compass to New Haven Harbor Lighted Whistle Buoy "NH"?
You depart from the position in the previous question at 2114 and make good 12 knots on a course of 040°T.  At what time will you sight New Haven Light if the visibility is 11 miles?

At 2142, you take the following bearings:

Stratford Point Light                           331°T  
Stratford Shoal Middle Ground Light  280°T  
Old Field Point Light                           223°T  

What is your 2142 position?
What was the speed made good between 2114 and 2142?

At 0109 you get underway, and at 0112 you take the following Loran-C readings:

 9960-W-15026.9
 9960-X-26536.9
 9960-Y-44015.7

What is your 0112 position?
At 0112, what is the approximate depth under the keel?

options: a hard sand shoal marked with a light
completely submerged at all stages of the tide
surrounded by rocks awash at low water spring tides
a small, low, sandy islet surrounded by shoal water
question: Branford Reef is __________.
At 0112, the radar range to Branford Reef Light is 2.9 miles.  At 0125, the range is 3.6 miles.  What is the position of your 0125 running fix if you are steering 124°T at 12 knots?`

At 0200, you take the following bearings:

Falkner Island Light           004.5°T  
Kelsey Pt. Breakwater Lt.  054.0°T  
Horton Point Light             115.0°T

options: the shore is bluff and rocky
the lookout tower is marked with radar reflectors
question: The shoreline along Rocky Point should give a good radar return because __________.

options: The true heading at the observation was 090°.
question: You sight Bartlett Reef Light in line with New London Harbor Light bearing 043°pgc.  You are heading 088°pgc and 098.5° per standard magnetic compass at the time of the observation.  Which statement is TRUE?

Stratford Point Light 020°pgc  Stratford Shoal (Middle Ground) Light 141°pgc  

What is your 0452 position?

options: You will not sight the light.

options: are being set to the north
are not affected by a current
question: Based on your running fix, you __________.
Your 0507 position is about 7 miles from Bridgeport, CT. What is the distance from this position to Newport, RI?

options: backed by marshes and wooded uplands
question: The south shore of Long Island Sound near your position is __________.

At 0615, Stratford Point Light bears 292°pgc, Falkner Island Light bears 052°pgc, and Branford Reef Light bears 018°pgc.  What was the current since 0530?

At 0700, Falkner Island Light bears 023°pgc, and the range to the south tip of Falkner Island is 7.1 miles.  What was the course made good since 0615?

At 0705, the gyro loses power.  At 0715, you are on course 092° per standard magnetic compass (psc) when you take the following bearings:  Falkner Light bears 356°psc, Horton Point Light bears 123°psc, and Kelsey Point Breakwater Light bears 048°psc.  What is the position of your 0715 fix?

options: is shown from a white square tower
is synchronized with a radio beacon
question: Horton Point Light __________.
If visibility permits, Little Gull Island Light will break the horizon at a range of approximately __________.

From your 0100 position, you change course to 258° per standard magnetic compass.  Your engine speed is 10.0 knots.  A short time later, your fathometer reads 51 feet (15.5 meters) under the keel.  What is the water depth?

options: You are in the red sector of New London Harbor Light.
You can follow loran reading 9960-Y-43990 to remain clear of all dangers until west of Stratford Shoal.
Little Gull Island Light bears 339°T at 4.3 miles.
question: At 2216 your position is LAT 41°16.0'N, LONG 72°08.0'W. Which statement is TRUE?

If you estimate 3° leeway due to northerly winds, which course will you steer per standard magnetic compass (psc)
to make good 255°T?

You sight Bartlett Reef Light in range with New London Harbor Light bearing 038°pgc.  At the time of the bearing,
the helmsman reports he was heading 253°pgc and 269° per standard magnetic compass.  What is the deviation for that heading?

At 2255 you take the following visual bearings. 

Saybrook Breakwater Light 333°pgc  
Little Gull Island Light          094°pgc 
Horton Point Light               211°pgc 

What is your position?

At 2308 your position is LAT 41°12.7'N, LONG 72°22.8'W.
You steer a course to make good 255°T from this position. At 2310 you receive a distress call from a vessel anchored 2.1 miles due north of Mattituck Inlet Light.  If you change course at 2314, what is the course to steer per gyrocompass to arrive at the distress site if you allow 2°
leeway for northerly winds, 3°E gyro error and correct your course for a current of 073°T at 1.3 knots?
Based on the information in the previous question, what is your ETA at the distress scene?

At 2347 you are advised that your assistance is no longer needed.  At 2350 you change course to make good 268°T.  At 0015 you take the following round of bearings:
  Kelsey Point Breakwater light  024°pgc 
  Horton Point Light                   100°pgc 
  Falkner Island Light                 333°pgc  

At 0030 Falkner Island Lt. bears 000°T at 5.9 miles.

What is the course and speed made good between 0015 and 0030?
At 0030 you alter course and speed to make good 265°T at 10 knots.  What is your ETA at a point where Stratford Shoal Middle Ground Light is abeam?

options: You should alter course to the right to increase the rate of the bearing change.
You are making more speed over the ground than you estimated.
You should alter course to decrease the distance that you will pass off Middle Ground Shoal.
You can hold the present course and safely pass buoy "18".
question: At 0100 you notice that the wind has become SSW'ly and has freshened. At 0200 you sight Stratford Point Lighted Bell Buoy "18" bearing 268°pgc.  At 0215 the buoy bears 269°pgc.  Which statement is TRUE?

At 1930 you obtain two radar ranges:  Hammonasset Point at 4.1 miles and the East side of Falkner Island at 7.6 miles.  What is your position?

What VHF frequency would you use to listen to a weather forecast for the eastern part of Long Island Sound?

At 2130 New Haven buoy "NH" bears 337° per gyro compass and Middle Ground Lt bears 254° per gyro compass.  You must arrive 0.3 miles off Port Jefferson buoy "PJ" at 2300.  What speed will you have to make good, for arrival at 2300?
From the 2130 position, you steer 236°T at 10 knots.  A strong northerly wind is causing 4° of leeway.  What course must you steer per standard compass, to make good 236°T?

options: Wooded, barren hills with a rocky beach
Low, rocky cliffs with heavily wooded hills inland
Sand dunes and beaches with a mud and sand bottom
Sand bluffs 60 feet high and banks dug out by sand and gravel companies
question: Which statement best describes the shoreline at Mount Misery?

 9960-X-26545.9

 9960-W-14930.5
 9960-X-26417.0
 9960-Y-44006.5

what true course will you steer from the 0925 position to arrive at a position 0.5 mile south of Long Sand Shoal West End Horn Buoy "W"?

 The range to the eastern most point of Falkner Island is 3.3 miles, and the range to Horton Point is 10.1 miles. What is your position at 0946?

options: shoals gradually on the north and south sides
shows breakers when northerly winds exceed 10 knots
has gray sand with scattered shells
question: Long Sand Shoal __________.

options: The sounding datum is based on extreme low water and no correction is necessary
question: During extreme low water, the soundings near Saybrook may require corrections up to __________.

options: north of your intended track line
three miles southeast of Six Mile Reef Buoy "8A"
question:
You take a Loran-C fix at 1130 using the following lines:

 9960-X-26319
 9960-W-14880

options: 3.1 miles SSW of Falkner Island Light
question:
From your 1155 position, you steer a course of 282°T at a speed of 9.5 knots.  You obtain the following bearings:

  1205:  Falkner Island Light bears 318°T  
  1225:  Falkner Island Light bears 355°T

options: Your fathometer should indicate a reading of approximately 47 feet.
Bradford Reef is 5.7 miles on the starboard bow.
You are in a danger area.

question: At the time of your 1245 position, which statement is TRUE?
